Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

People know I'm not a big fan of exposing the image locations stuff, but I think we need to be careful here in terms of trying to deprecate the multiple locations stuff.

There's no detail here on why this is being done, or its affect on the location's strategy stuff for example.

Patch Set 1:

Stuart, yup! This draft is just to kickstart the discussion. FWIW, this has been discussed in the past already as part of other patches and bugs.

I'll provide more details but I wanted to get some sort of consensus before I even go and try to fix all the CI jobs and whatnot.

Patch Set 1:

Can you please mark this as -W? Just to avoid scaring people.

---


1:41:14 PM <nikhil> flaper87: I was thinking -- this is a good idea. but we should do it in newton preferably after nova stuff is merged though
1:41:31 PM <nikhil> flaper87: mostly as this can result into disrupting that workflow
1:41:38 PM <nikhil> flaper87: those are my initial thoughts
1:41:39 PM <flaper87> nikhil: sure, not super urgent. TBH. I just want to start poking folks heads before I go and fix gfate issues and what not
1:41:45 PM <flaper87> the change per-se is quite small
1:42:10 PM <nikhil> flaper87: yeah, it's good idea overall (at least I think so)

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

I perfer the RBAC way. Currently, users can't add/replace/remove the image's locations by default(show_multiple_locations=false), even for admin users. the locations can be updated only when show_multiple_locations=true. Use a config option to limit a request seems heavy, this kind of work should be done by RBAC mechanism IMO.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Is the debtcollector being used by oslo.config? The config option merely marks removal for deprecation.

We need UpgradeImpact, DocImpact, (not Security though). Also, we need good release notes -- I am happy to write those if you are short of bandwidth, just let me know.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Nikhil is right, sysadmins should somehow be notified of the removal of this option, and the doc should be up to date.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Frankly speaking I think that marking it as deprecated is not enough. First, we need to set 'role:admin' to related policies like it was done in previous PS; second, change this value to True by default; and the last - completely disable showing locations to users and create new API admin-only request like GET /v2/images/{image_id}/locations, that returns json representation of image locations. We may discuss it on IRC meeting.

Patch Set 3:

Nikhil, thanks I'll update accordingly. +1 to all the tags and release notes.

Mike, I'm afraid changing the policy file will change the default behavior and it'll break the API. I believe we shouldn't be changing any of the rules now and delay that until the next cycle. Not changing the rules now is part of the deprecation path.
